The premise of this comment is inaccurate.

Under the Montreal Convention, it does not matter what caused the delay. Liability depends on whether the airline has taken all reasonable measures to prevent the or mitigate delay -- regardless of what was the original cause.

The airline cannot point to a third party. It has to pay compensation, and then sue the third party independently.

Zachary Desilets One of the core mandates of the CTA is providing consumer protection for air passengers. We take that role very seriously.

Here in Canada, there is a division of responsibilities for consumer protection between the federal and provincial Governments.
